properties.name: Bridging the Gap's Midtown Community Recycling Center
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing4745 Forest Avenue, Kansas City, MO(816) 561-1090 Wednesday - Friday 11am - 5:30pm Saturday 8am - 4pm Items accepted: batteries, computer monitors (5 fee), CPUs, inkjet and toner cartridges, printers ( fee), video tapes and disks, cell phones and equipment

properties.name: Kansas City Community Recycling Center
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing400 Northwest Barry Road, Kansas City, MO(816) 420-8670 Summer Hours: Wednesday - Friday 11am - 7pm and Saturday 8am - 4pm Winter Hours: Wednesday - Friday 11am - 5pm and Saturday 8am - 4pm Items accepted: batteries, inkjet and toner cartridges

properties.name: Kelly's Westport Inn
properties.description: Posted by Brunopier  500 Westport Rd, Kansas City, 64111cheap beer: me likey. plus, it\'s connected to joe\'s pizza (for those times when you find yourself drinking on an empty stomach) and down the street from the westport coffeehouse (for those times when your friend needs to google someone she wants to go home with).

properties.name: Kona Grill
properties.description: Posted by Brunopier 444 Ward Pkwy Kansas City, MOthe crowd is not great, but come on -- they have sushi as part of their happy hour (and reverse happy hour) specials! gotta love that.

properties.name: Negro Leagues Baseball Museum
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  1616 E. 18th St., Kansas City, MO 64108Founded in 1990, the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum (NLBM) is a privately funded, non-profit organization dedicated to preserving the rich hitory of African-American baseball. Experience a tour of multi-media displays, museum store, hundreds of photographs and artifacts dating from the late 1800s through the 1960s. The NLBM opened it\'s permanent 10,000 square foot facility in 1997 sharing the new 18th and Vine museum complex with the American Jazz Museum. ---www.nlbm.com

properties.name: The Beaumont
properties.description: Posted by Momisery4050 pennsylvania kansas cityA country bar. I\'ve been there too many time to count, I used to run with that crowd a little, and fell for a girl who rode the mechanical bull.

properties.name: The Brick
properties.description: Posted by Momisery1727 Mcgee St kansas city moArguably the center of Kansas City\'s local rock scene, this bar is what you\'d expect: hipsters, stiff drinks and an overpowering sound system. I hear that Sunday night emo karaoke is the best in town.

properties.name: The Cup and Saucer
properties.description: Posted by Brunopier 412 Delaware St, Kansas City, MOyay drink specials. yay live music. yay couches.

properties.name: The Granfalloon
properties.description: Posted by Brunopier 608 Ward Pkwy Kansas City, MOhe granbabboon. ok priced drinks. lots of tvs. not the place to go after the cardinals are in town.

properties.name: The News Room
properties.description: Posted by Momisery3704 broadway kansas cityA 2am dive bar, decorated with vintage type writers strewn about. A couple of pool tables draw the shark set, though this is a hipster stronghold.

properties.name: The Record Bar
properties.description: Posted by Missae   1020 Westport Rd, Kansas City, MO

properties.name: The Toy and Miniature Museum
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily  5235 Oak Street, Kansas City, MODo you ever find yourself painstakingly dressing your children\'s Polly Pockets, or carefully arranging a tiny place setting for a group of Calico Critters, and think, "damn, this is fun?" If so, you should consider getting yourself over to the Toy and Miniature Museum of Kansas City. Read more.

properties.name: Theater for Young America
properties.description: Posted by Freestatefamily 30 W. Pershing Rd. , Kansas City, MOTheater for Young America\'s performances at Union Station\'s City Stage are an example of children\'s theater at its best. The plays involve both professional actors and children from Theater for Young America\'s drama classes. Read more.
